reviewText: An entertaining movie but not as good as the first Santa Baby. The original story was much better. Still liked it.
Jennifer McCarthy is so perfect in this Christmas dvd, I enjoyed the first Santa Baby so much and decided to buy Santa Baby 2 and I was not disappointed, very good DVD for Christmas holidays!
A great movie to have on hand at Christmas time to keep the kids busy. Acting was good, plot was typical. Not going to win any awards but enjoyable to watch.

This movie is a sequel to the first movie "Santa Baby". I found it to be good for a sequel. Most sequel are usually better than the original because the makers can embellish the story based on the first.
Im glad to finally have this movie again. I was given this movie from my Grandma and my cousin broke it so I had to find another copy.

I watch Sanata Baby 2 on TV and it was good that it why I order it from you so I watch it again.  Because it was a good movie.

Betty A. Swaigan

I ordered this as a gift for my deaf brother, and even though the online information indicated that it had close captioning, it does not.
Product Details that were promised:

  * Actors: Jenny McCarthy, George Wendt, Ivan Sergei
  * Directors: Ron Underwood
  * Format: Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DVD, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC
  * Language: English
  * Region: Region 1 (U.S. and Canada only. Read more about DVD formats.)
  * Aspect Ratio: 2.35:1
  * Number of discs: 1
  * Rated: PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)
  * Studio: Lionsgate Home Entertainment
  * DVD Release Date: November 20, 2007

In fact it does not even include the subtitles.....
Would really like to have truth in advertising!

I loved Santa Baby 1.  It was a good Christmas flick.  I don't know what happened here.  No offense.  The actors were great.  They were just the wrong actors.  If they could have stuck with the original cast it would have been much better.  I ordered this on Amazon, and found it on Netflix to view for free.  I started watching it, 20 minutes later decided I had made an "accidental" purchase.  Sending it back.

This is a real cute movie. Fun, quite colorful,which is important to me for a Santa movie. Good kids movie also. Entertaining,alot going on to keep their attention. DVD received was NOT Widescreen!
DVD I received is in the old 4:3 (screen ratio) narrow screen format; the same as your old 1950's TV screen, NOT Widescreen as in Amazon description.
I'm surprised that any widescreen movie made in 2009 is released to DVD in the old 4:3 screen ratio format!
I discovered that there is a German released DVD version in widescreen which makes no sense at all.
Please note: The widescreen region 2 German version will not play in region 1 USA players!

I love watching Santa Baby 1 & 2 on TV so I got these movies for my bosses wife for Christmas & she loves them.

Not as good, perhaps, as Santa Baby, but it is a very nice sequel indeed.  Mary Class (Jenny McCarthy) has to return to the North Pole when her father decides to give up being Santa and goes off to find himself.  She was planning to do that anyway, but was busy with other things -- she is wonderful at multi-tasking.  But when she gets to the Pole she finds that there are lots of problems, more than the last time.

  It is a pleasant movie and it is great to see the elves and other characters returning.  If you liked the first one, and/or you like movies about Santa, this one should appeal to you.
One of my all-time favorite Christmas movies.
Love Christmas movies
Adorable movie! Love getting to stay in the holiday spirit year round.

Finally got the chance to see both Santa Baby 1(2006) and 2(2009)and I must say,I am impressed. Jenny Mc Carthy did a pretty good job playing Mary Class,Santa's daughter of course. She changed her last name from Claus to Class (probably)to fit it in the big city and so as not to be associated with Santa Claus. It wasn't mentioned in the movie why only that Mary changed it. Anyway,most of the original cast came back except Santa himself which was originally played by George Wendt and in this sequel by Paul Sorvino. Luke is played by Dean McDermott,originally played by Ivan Sergei. Mrs. Claus is as delightful and Gary the Elf with his facial expressions kind of remind me of Mr. Bean. I still like the first one but this sequel doesn't disappoint. Santa Baby 1&2 are one of the best movies of ABC Family's 25 Days of Christmas not to mention Mistletones (Tia Mowry,Tori Spelling)and Holidaze (Jennie Garth).Will definitely add these movies to my collection.

Didn't like this one as much as the first, but still it was a good entertaining Christmas film for the whole family.  New boyfriend and new Santa, but both do a good job.  Jenny McCarthy returns as Mary Class trying to keep the family business going.  This one actually had two plots going.  First and the one I didn't care for, has Santa deciding to quit the business and become a hippy jazz musician to do his own thing and be his real self.  The second plot has Terry (Kelly Stables) a newcomer to the North Pole out to sabotage Mary and move in and take over the North Pole for herself.  A cute holiday tale and well worth a watch for the family.
Awesome movie! It's a favorite in my home! Love love love!

I enjoyed the first installment more, but then that is the norm, right? Jenny McCarthy does a great job as Santa Claus' daughter and Dean McDermott does a great job as her husband. I love the atmosphere portrayed in the "north pole", with the decorations and the elves and all of the activity. Santa wants to travel with his newly formed band, he's tired, so his daughter, a successful business woman, tries to incorporate new ideas which end up in disaster. Not to worry though, everything always works out at Christmas. I watch both Santa Baby and Santa Baby 2 every year.
I love this movie I could just watch it over and over again. Can a lot faster than I thought it would

I really enjoyed Santa Baby and thought it was a good heartwarming Christmas story. Having said that, Santa Baby (2) is still pretty good but not as good as the original. Still worth purchasing if you like to collect the better Christmas movies! Jenny McCarthy is great in both films!
Love the spirit of Christmas, just as we all have our trials but we can all appreciate the gift of Christmas brings to each of us and our families.

I've seen it before, but it never gets old. Unlike in Santa Baby, Terry is helping Mary and Santa this year, but what could go wrong?  I don't want to give away the story, so watch how Christmas almost is lost but is eventually saved...

In Santa Baby 2: Christmas Maybe Jenny McCarthy is back as Mary Class.  Mary is the daughter of Santa Claus (Paul Sorvino) who has to head back to the North Pole to help her dad run the toy  shop. Mary and her boyfriend, Luke (Dean McDermott) comes back home to the North Pole when they grew-up.  One reason Mary has to return to the North Pole is Santa is dealing with a late-life crisis.  Santa is ready to retire, he is tired of the responsiblities of being Santa.  Santa is ready to pass the job down to Mary.  But Mary has completion for the Santa job.  A young woman named Teri (Kelly Stables) who is the post office carrier and the assistant for Santa wants to take Mary down for the job.  Watch this movie to see what happens to these characters. Hint: there is surprise about Teri!  Who will deliver the presents to the children? Will it Mary, Santa, or Teri?
My son collects Christmas movies and this was an addition to his collection.  He's happy w/this movie since Jenny is a favorite actress/model of his.
